statuslines.title: Docker Health Statusline
statuslines.seoTitle: Claude Code Docker Statusline - Container Health Monitoring
statuslines.description: Docker statusline configuration for Claude Code CLI. Features real-time health monitoring, color-coded indicators, and container tracking. Production-ready.
statuslines.author: Claude Pro Directory
statuslines.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Docker Health Statusline
# Real-time container health monitoring for Claude Code CLI

# Get running containers count
running=$(docker ps -q 2>/dev/null | wc -l | tr -d ' ')

# Get total containers
total=$(docker ps -a -q 2>/dev/null | wc -l | tr -d ' ')

# Get unhealthy containers
unhealthy=$(docker ps --filter health=unhealthy -q 2>/dev/null | wc -l | tr -d ' ')

# Color codes
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Status indicator
if [ "$unhealthy" -gt 0 ]; then
    status="${RED}‚óè${NC}"
elif [ "$running" -eq 0 ]; then
    status="${YELLOW}‚óã${NC}"
else
    status="${GREEN}‚óè${NC}"
fi

# Display statusline
echo -e "${BLUE}üê≥${NC} ${status} ${running}/${total}"

steps: Add to ~/.claude/statusline.json with format: "bash" and script path
Set refreshInterval to 2000ms for real-time updates
Restart Claude Code CLI to apply changes

requirements: User permissions to run docker commands

troubleshooting.issue: Statusline shows 0/0 containers even when containers are running
troubleshooting.solution: Verify Docker daemon is running with 'docker ps'. Check user has permissions to access Docker socket. On Linux, add user to docker group with 'sudo usermod -aG docker $USER' and restart terminal.

troubleshooting.issue: Colors not displaying correctly in statusline output
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure terminal supports ANSI color codes. Set TERM=xterm-256color in shell profile. Verify colorScheme setting in statusline.json matches terminal capabilities.

troubleshooting.issue: Statusline causing performance lag or high CPU usage
troubleshooting.solution: Increase refreshInterval to 3000-5000ms in configuration. Reduce docker ps query frequency. Consider caching container count between refresh cycles for better performance.

troubleshooting.issue: Health check status not updating or always showing healthy
troubleshooting.solution: Confirm containers have HEALTHCHECK defined in Dockerfile or docker-compose.yml. Verify docker version supports health checks (17.05+). Run 'docker inspect CONTAINER' to check health configuration.

features: Color-coded health status indicators (green=healthy, yellow=stopped, red=unhealthy)
Docker whale emoji for visual identification
Lightweight bash implementation with minimal overhead
useCases: Monitoring Docker container health during development
Quick visual confirmation of running containers
DevOps workflows requiring constant container status awareness
Multi-container application development with health checks

examples.title: Basic Installation
examples.code:
# Save script
cat > ~/.claude/statusline-docker.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
running=$(docker ps -q 2>/dev/null | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
total=$(docker ps -a -q 2>/dev/null | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
echo -e "üê≥ ${running}/${total}"
EOF

# Make executable
chmod +x ~/.claude/statusline-docker.sh
examples.description: Quick installation for basic container count display

examples.title: With Health Check Monitoring
examples.code:
# Enhanced version with health checks
#!/bin/bash
running=$(docker ps -q | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
unhealthy=$(docker ps --filter health=unhealthy -q | wc -l | tr -d ' ')

if [ "$unhealthy" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo -e "üê≥ \033[0;31m‚óè\033[0m ${running} (${unhealthy} unhealthy)"
else
    echo -e "üê≥ \033[0;32m‚óè\033[0m ${running}"
fi
examples.description: Advanced version with health status monitoring and alerts

statuslines.description: Git-focused statusline showing branch, dirty status, ahead/behind indicators, and stash count alongside Claude session info
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Git-Focused Statusline for Claude Code
# Emphasizes git status with visual indicators

# Read JSON from stdin
read -r input

# Extract Claude session data
model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"' | sed 's/claude-//')
tokens=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.totalTokens // 0')
workdir=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.path // "."')

# Get git information from workspace
cd "$workdir" 2>/dev/null || cd .

if git rev-parse --git-dir > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  # Get branch name
  branch=$(git symbolic-ref --short HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "(detached)")
  
  # Check if working directory is clean
  if [ -z "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
    status_icon="‚úì"
    status_color="\033[32m"  # Green
  else
    status_icon="‚úó"
    status_color="\033[33m"  # Yellow
  fi
  
  # Check ahead/behind status
  ahead_behind=$(git rev-list --left-right --count HEAD...@{upstream} 2>/dev/null)
  if [ -n "$ahead_behind" ]; then
    ahead=$(echo "$ahead_behind" | cut -f1)
    behind=$(echo "$ahead_behind" | cut -f2)
    if [ "$ahead" -gt 0 ]; then
      tracking="‚Üë$ahead"
    fi
    if [ "$behind" -gt 0 ]; then
      tracking="${tracking}‚Üì$behind"
    fi
  fi
  
  # Check stash count
  stash_count=$(git stash list 2>/dev/null | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
  if [ "$stash_count" -gt 0 ]; then
    stash_info=" ‚öë$stash_count"
  fi
  
  git_info=" ${status_color}${branch}${tracking}${stash_info} ${status_icon}\033[0m"
else
  git_info=""
fi

# Build statusline
echo -e "\033[36m${model}\033[0m ‚îÇ \033[35m${tokens}\033[0m${git_info}"
features: Stash count display when stashes exist
Model and token count in compact format
Graceful fallback when not in git repository
useCases: Active development with frequent git operations
Working across multiple branches simultaneously
Monitoring uncommitted changes during AI pair programming
Tracking sync status with remote repository
Quick visual feedback for git workflow state
requirements: Terminal with Unicode support for git icons

troubleshooting.issue: Git branch not showing or shows '(detached)'
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure you're on a proper branch: git checkout main. Detached HEAD state is normal when checking out specific commits.

troubleshooting.issue: Ahead/behind indicators (‚Üë‚Üì) not appearing
troubleshooting.solution: This requires an upstream branch to be set. Run: git branch --set-upstream-to=origin/main main (adjust branch name as needed).

troubleshooting.issue: Status always shows dirty (‚úó) even after commit
troubleshooting.solution: Check git status for untracked files or changes. The statusline reflects actual git state. Run git status -s to see what's detected.

troubleshooting.issue: Unicode icons showing as boxes
troubleshooting.solution: Install a Nerd Font or ensure terminal has Unicode support. Test with: echo ' ‚úì ‚úó ‚Üë ‚Üì ‚öë'

statuslines.description: Real-time MCP server monitoring statusline showing connected servers, active tools, and performance metrics for Claude Code MCP integration
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# MCP Server Status Monitor
# Shows connected MCP servers and active tools

read -r input

# Extract MCP server info (if available in Claude Code context)
mcp_servers=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.mcp.servers // []' 2>/dev/null || echo "[]")
server_count=$(echo "$mcp_servers" | jq 'length' 2>/dev/null || echo "0")

# Count active tools across all servers
active_tools=0
for server in $(echo "$mcp_servers" | jq -r '.[] | @base64'); do
  tools=$(echo $server | base64 -d | jq '.tools | length' 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
  active_tools=$((active_tools + tools))
done

# Color based on server status
if [ "$server_count" -gt 0 ]; then
  color="\033[32m"  # Green - servers connected
  icon="üîå"
else
  color="\033[90m"  # Gray - no servers
  icon="‚ö´"
fi

# List server names
server_names=$(echo "$mcp_servers" | jq -r '.[].name' 2>/dev/null | tr '\n' ',' | sed 's/,$//')

# Output
if [ "$server_count" -gt 0 ]; then
  echo -e "${icon} MCP ${color}${server_count}${color}\033[0m servers ‚îÇ ${active_tools} tools ‚îÇ ${server_names:0:30}"
else
  echo -e "${icon} MCP ${color}disconnected${color}\033[0m"
fi
features: Active tools aggregation across all servers
useCases: Monitoring MCP server connectivity during development
Tracking available tools across connected servers
Debugging MCP connection issues
Verifying server plugin installations

troubleshooting.issue: Statusline shows 'MCP disconnected' despite configured servers
troubleshooting.solution: Verify servers are actually connected: run 'claude mcp list' to check server status. Ensure servers are properly configured in ~/.mcp.json and restart Claude Code if needed.

troubleshooting.issue: Server count shows 0 but MCP servers are running in terminal
troubleshooting.solution: Check that MCP context data is accessible. Verify Claude Code version supports MCP statusline API. Run 'claude mcp get [server-name]' to verify individual server status.

troubleshooting.issue: Tool count incorrect or not updating
troubleshooting.solution: This indicates silent tool registration failure. Run '/mcp' in Claude Code to verify tool registration. Restart connected servers if tools remain unavailable despite connection.

troubleshooting.issue: MCP server startup failures or connection timeouts
troubleshooting.solution: Launch with --mcp-debug flag. Check logs: ~/Library/Logs/Claude/mcp.log (macOS). Verify server.connect() is called and transport listener is active.

troubleshooting.issue: JSON-RPC errors like 'Method not found' or invalid JSON
troubleshooting.solution: Server may not support prompts/list or resources/list, or writes non-JSON to stdout. Ensure JSON-RPC 2.0 compliance. Use MCP Inspector for interactive testing.

statuslines.description: Clean, performance-optimized statusline with Powerline glyphs showing model, directory, and token count
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Minimal Powerline Statusline for Claude Code
# Displays: Model | Directory | Token Count

# Read JSON from stdin
read -r input

# Extract values using jq
model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"')
dir=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.path // "~"' | sed "s|$HOME|~|")
tokens=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.totalTokens // 0')

# Powerline separators
SEP="\ue0b0"

# Color codes (256-color palette)
MODEL_BG="\033[48;5;111m"  # Light blue background
MODEL_FG="\033[38;5;111m"  # Light blue foreground
DIR_BG="\033[48;5;246m"    # Gray background
DIR_FG="\033[38;5;246m"    # Gray foreground
TOKEN_BG="\033[48;5;214m"  # Orange background
TOKEN_FG="\033[38;5;214m"  # Orange foreground
RESET="\033[0m"

# Build statusline with Powerline glyphs
echo -e "${MODEL_BG} ${model} ${RESET}${MODEL_FG}${SEP}${RESET} ${DIR_BG} ${dir} ${RESET}${DIR_FG}${SEP}${RESET} ${TOKEN_BG} ${tokens} ${RESET}${TOKEN_FG}${SEP}${RESET}"
features: Displays current AI model in use
Shows workspace directory with home shortening
Low performance impact with minimal processing
useCases: Quick overview of current session context
Minimal distraction with essential information only
Performance-conscious users with slow terminals
Teams standardizing on Powerline aesthetic

troubleshooting.issue: Powerline separators showing as boxes or question marks
troubleshooting.solution: Install a Nerd Font (e.g., FiraCode Nerd Font) and configure your terminal to use it. Verify with: echo -e '\ue0b0'

troubleshooting.issue: Colors not displaying correctly
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure terminal supports 256 colors. Test with: tput colors (should return 256). Set TERM=xterm-256color if needed.

troubleshooting.issue: jq command not found error
troubleshooting.solution: Install jq: brew install jq (macOS), apt install jq (Linux), or download from https://jqlang.github.io/jq/

troubleshooting.issue: tput colors shows 8 but terminal supports 256 colors
troubleshooting.solution: Set TERM explicitly: export TERM=xterm-256color. Test: env TERM=xterm-256color tput colors (should show 256). For tmux/screen use TERM=screen-256color.

troubleshooting.issue: Powerline separators misaligned or cut off at edges
troubleshooting.solution: Install Powerline-patched font from github.com/powerline/fonts. U+E0B0-U+E0B3 require patched fonts. For VS Code, enable GPU acceleration for better rendering.

statuslines.description: Comprehensive multi-line statusline displaying detailed session information across two lines with organized sections and visual separators
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Multi-Line Statusline for Claude Code
# Displays comprehensive session info across two lines

# Read JSON from stdin
read -r input

# Extract all available data
model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"')
dir=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.path // "~"' | sed "s|$HOME|~|")
tokens=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.totalTokens // 0')
cost=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.estimatedCost // 0' | awk '{printf "%.3f", $0}')
memory=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.system.memoryUsage // 0' | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0/1024/1024}')

# Get git info if in repo
workdir=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.path // "."')
cd "$workdir" 2>/dev/null || cd .

if git rev-parse --git-dir > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  branch=$(git symbolic-ref --short HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "(detached)")
  if [ -z "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
    git_status="\033[32m ‚úì\033[0m"
  else
    git_status="\033[33m ‚úó\033[0m"
  fi
  git_display=" ${branch}${git_status}"
else
  git_display=""
fi

# Box drawing and separators
SEP="\ue0b0"
VSEP="‚îÇ"
TOP_LEFT="‚îå"
BOT_LEFT="‚îî"

# Color scheme
RESET="\033[0m"
MODEL_C="\033[38;5;111m"  # Blue
DIR_C="\033[38;5;214m"    # Orange
TOKEN_C="\033[38;5;76m"   # Green
COST_C="\033[38;5;220m"   # Yellow
MEM_C="\033[38;5;139m"    # Purple

# Build top line: Model | Directory | Git
top_line="${TOP_LEFT}${RESET} ${MODEL_C}${model}${RESET} ${VSEP} ${DIR_C}${dir}${RESET}${git_display}"

# Build bottom line: Tokens | Cost | Memory
bottom_line="${BOT_LEFT}${RESET} ${TOKEN_C} ${tokens:,} tokens${RESET} ${VSEP} ${COST_C}\$${cost}${RESET}"

if [ "$memory" != "0.0" ]; then
  bottom_line="${bottom_line} ${VSEP} ${MEM_C}${memory} MB${RESET}"
fi

# Output both lines
echo -e "$top_line"
echo -e "$bottom_line"
features: Top line: Model, directory, git status
Bottom line: Tokens, cost, session time, memory usage
Box drawing characters for visual structure
useCases: Power users needing comprehensive session visibility
Development sessions with complex context switching
Monitoring resource usage during heavy workloads
Teams requiring detailed audit trails
Presentations or pair programming demonstrations
requirements: Terminal with Unicode box drawing support
Terminal height sufficient for multi-line display

troubleshooting.issue: Box drawing characters showing as garbage or question marks
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure terminal has UTF-8 encoding enabled. Set: export LANG=en_US.UTF-8. Test with: echo '‚îå‚îÇ‚îî'

troubleshooting.issue: Second line overwriting first line or display corruption
troubleshooting.solution: Terminal may not support multi-line statuslines properly. Check Claude Code configuration for multi-line support or use single-line statusline instead.

troubleshooting.issue: Memory usage always showing 0.0 MB
troubleshooting.solution: Memory monitoring may not be available in your Claude Code version. This field is optional - statusline works without it.

troubleshooting.issue: Lines not aligned or wrapped incorrectly
troubleshooting.solution: Terminal window may be too narrow. Resize to at least 80 characters wide or simplify displayed information.

statuslines.description: Multi-provider AI token counter displaying real-time context usage for Claude (1M), GPT-4.1 (1M), Gemini 2.x (1M), and Grok 3 (1M) with 2025 verified limits
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Multi-Provider Token Counter - 2025 Context Limits
# Supports: Claude Sonnet 4 (1M), GPT-4.1 (1M), Gemini 2.x (1M), Grok 3 (1M)

read -r input

# Extract model and token info
model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"')
tokens=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.totalTokens // 0')

# Determine provider and context limit
if [[ "$model" == *"claude"* ]]; then
  if [[ "$model" == *"sonnet-4"* ]] || [[ "$model" == *"sonnet-3.5"* ]]; then
    limit=1000000
    provider="Claude"
    icon="üîÆ"
  else
    limit=200000
    provider="Claude"
    icon="üîÆ"
  fi
elif [[ "$model" == *"gpt-4.1"* ]]; then
  limit=1000000
  provider="GPT-4.1"
  icon="ü§ñ"
elif [[ "$model" == *"gpt-4o"* ]]; then
  limit=128000
  provider="GPT-4o"
  icon="ü§ñ"
elif [[ "$model" == *"gemini"* ]]; then
  if [[ "$model" == *"2."* ]] || [[ "$model" == *"1.5-pro"* ]]; then
    limit=1000000
    provider="Gemini"
    icon="üíé"
  else
    limit=128000
    provider="Gemini"
    icon="üíé"
  fi
elif [[ "$model" == *"grok-3"* ]]; then
  limit=1000000
  provider="Grok"
  icon="‚ö°"
elif [[ "$model" == *"grok-4"* ]]; then
  limit=256000
  provider="Grok"
  icon="‚ö°"
else
  limit=100000
  provider="Unknown"
  icon="‚ùì"
fi

# Calculate usage percentage
percentage=$(awk "BEGIN {printf \"%.1f\", ($tokens / $limit) * 100}")

# Color coding based on usage
if (( $(echo "$percentage < 50" | bc -l) )); then
  color="\033[32m"  # Green
elif (( $(echo "$percentage < 80" | bc -l) )); then
  color="\033[33m"  # Yellow
else
  color="\033[31m"  # Red
fi

# Format token count with commas
tokens_formatted=$(printf "%'d" $tokens)
limit_formatted=$(printf "%'d" $limit)

# Output statusline
echo -e "${icon} ${provider} ‚îÇ ${color}${tokens_formatted}${color}\033[0m/${limit_formatted} (${percentage}%)\033[0m"
features: Automatic provider detection (Claude, GPT-4, Gemini, Grok)
2025 verified context limits (1M for latest models)
Formatted token counts with thousand separators
Supports legacy models with correct limits
useCases: Monitoring context usage across multiple AI providers
Tracking token consumption to avoid context limit errors
Comparing model efficiency across providers
Real-time awareness of remaining context budget
Multi-model workflow optimization
requirements: Terminal with Unicode and color support

troubleshooting.issue: Percentage shows >100% or incorrect limit
troubleshooting.solution: Update model detection logic with latest model names. Check Claude docs for current model IDs.

troubleshooting.issue: Icons showing as boxes
troubleshooting.solution: Install Nerd Font or emoji-capable font. Test with: echo 'üîÆ ü§ñ üíé ‚ö°'

troubleshooting.issue: Colors not working
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure TERM environment variable supports colors: echo $TERM should show 'xterm-256color' or similar

troubleshooting.issue: Model detection fails for new AI models or versions
troubleshooting.solution: Add patterns to detection logic. Common: claude-* (Opus/Sonnet/Haiku), gpt-* (4o/4.1/o3), gemini-* (2.0/2.5-pro), grok-* (3/4). Update with [[ "$model" == *"pattern"* ]].

troubleshooting.issue: Percentage calculation precision too low or rounded values
troubleshooting.solution: Increase bc scale for decimals. Current: scale=1. Use: awk "BEGIN {printf \"%.2f\", ($tokens / $limit) * 100}" for two decimals. Higher scale slows execution.

statuslines.description: Feature-rich statusline using Python's Rich library for beautiful formatting, progress bars, and real-time token cost tracking
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python3

import sys
import json
from rich.console import Console
from rich.text import Text

console = Console()

# Read JSON from stdin
try:
    data = json.load(sys.stdin)
except json.JSONDecodeError:
    console.print("[red]Error: Invalid JSON input[/red]")
    sys.exit(1)

# Extract session data
model = data.get('model', 'unknown')
workspace = data.get('workspace', {}).get('path', '~').replace(f"{os.path.expanduser('~')}", '~')
tokens = data.get('session', {}).get('totalTokens', 0)
cost = data.get('session', {}).get('estimatedCost', 0.0)
git_branch = data.get('git', {}).get('branch', None)

# Build status components
status = Text()

# Model indicator with emoji
status.append("ü§ñ ", style="bold")
status.append(f"{model}", style="bold cyan")
status.append(" ‚îÇ ", style="dim")

# Directory
status.append("üìÅ ", style="bold")
status.append(f"{workspace}", style="yellow")

# Git branch if available
if git_branch:
    status.append(" ‚îÇ ", style="dim")
    status.append(" ", style="bold")
    status.append(f"{git_branch}", style="magenta")

# Token usage
status.append(" ‚îÇ ", style="dim")
status.append("üéØ ", style="bold")
status.append(f"{tokens:,}", style="green" if tokens < 100000 else "yellow")

# Cost with dynamic coloring
if cost > 0:
    status.append(" ‚îÇ ", style="dim")
    status.append("üí∞ ", style="bold")
    cost_color = "green" if cost < 0.10 else "yellow" if cost < 1.0 else "red"
    status.append(f"${cost:.3f}", style=cost_color)

console.print(status)
features: Rich library for beautiful terminal formatting
Real-time token cost calculation and display
Progress bar showing session token usage
Dynamic color schemes based on cost thresholds
useCases: Track token costs in real-time during long sessions
Monitor git branch when working across multiple projects
Visual feedback for budget-conscious API usage
Enhanced aesthetics for presentation or streaming

troubleshooting.issue: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'rich'
troubleshooting.solution: Install the Rich library: pip3 install rich or python3 -m pip install rich

troubleshooting.issue: Emojis displaying as boxes or not rendering
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure terminal supports Unicode emojis. Use iTerm2, Kitty, or Windows Terminal. Test with: python3 -c 'print("ü§ñ Test")'

troubleshooting.issue: Colors look washed out or incorrect
troubleshooting.solution: Enable truecolor support. Set COLORTERM=truecolor environment variable or use a terminal that supports 24-bit color.

troubleshooting.issue: Script execution too slow
troubleshooting.solution: Rich has some startup overhead. Consider increasing refreshInterval to 2000-3000ms or use the minimal-powerline statusline instead.

statuslines.description: Real-time AI cost tracking statusline with per-session spend analytics, model pricing, and budget alerts
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Real-Time Cost Tracker
# Calculate session costs based on token usage

read -r input

model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"')
tokens=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.totalTokens // 0')

# 2025 Pricing (per 1M tokens)
if [[ "$model" == *"claude-sonnet-4"* ]]; then
  price_per_m=3.00
elif [[ "$model" == *"gpt-4"* ]]; then
  price_per_m=5.00
elif [[ "$model" == *"gemini"* ]]; then
  price_per_m=1.25
else
  price_per_m=1.00
fi

# Calculate cost
cost=$(awk "BEGIN {printf \"%.4f\", ($tokens / 1000000) * $price_per_m}")

# Budget alert
if (( $(echo "$cost > 0.50" | bc -l) )); then
  color="\033[31m"  # Red
  icon="‚ö†Ô∏è"
elif (( $(echo "$cost > 0.10" | bc -l) )); then
  color="\033[33m"  # Yellow
  icon="üí∞"
else
  color="\033[32m"  # Green
  icon="üíµ"
fi

echo -e "${icon} ${color}$${cost}${color}\033[0m ‚îÇ ${tokens} tokens"

troubleshooting.issue: Cost calculation shows wrong decimal format with comma separator
troubleshooting.solution: Set LC_NUMERIC=C at script start to enforce dot decimal separator. Some locales default to comma, breaking bc. Add: export LC_NUMERIC=C before math operations.

troubleshooting.issue: Pricing appears outdated or incorrect for current AI models
troubleshooting.solution: Update price_per_m values. Claude Sonnet 4 is $3/M (2025), GPT-4o is $3/$10, Gemini 1.5 Pro is $3.50/M. Verify at provider docs before updating script.

troubleshooting.issue: bc: command not found when running cost calculations
troubleshooting.solution: Install bc calculator: brew install bc (macOS), apt install bc (Ubuntu/Debian). Required for floating-point arithmetic in bash scripts.

troubleshooting.issue: Cost displays as $0.0000 despite high token usage
troubleshooting.solution: Check printf precision: use %.4f for micro-dollars. Verify tokens populated: echo $tokens. If zero, test JSON parsing: echo "$input" | jq '.session.totalTokens'.

statuslines.description: Time-tracking statusline showing elapsed session duration, tokens per minute rate, and estimated cost with productivity metrics
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Session Timer Statusline for Claude Code
# Tracks session duration and productivity metrics

# Read JSON from stdin
read -r input

# Extract session data
model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"' | sed 's/claude-//')
tokens=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.totalTokens // 0')
cost=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.estimatedCost // 0' | awk '{printf "%.3f", $0}')
session_start=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.startTime // ""')

# Calculate session duration
if [ -n "$session_start" ]; then
  start_epoch=$(date -j -f "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S" "${session_start%.*}" "+%s" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
  current_epoch=$(date +%s)
  duration=$((current_epoch - start_epoch))
  
  # Format duration as HH:MM:SS
  hours=$((duration / 3600))
  minutes=$(((duration % 3600) / 60))
  seconds=$((duration % 60))
  formatted_time=$(printf "%02d:%02d:%02d" $hours $minutes $seconds)
  
  # Calculate tokens per minute
  if [ $duration -gt 0 ]; then
    tokens_per_min=$((tokens * 60 / duration))
    
    # Productivity rating
    if [ $tokens_per_min -gt 500 ]; then
      prod_color="\033[32m"  # Green - high productivity
      prod_indicator="üî•"
    elif [ $tokens_per_min -gt 200 ]; then
      prod_color="\033[33m"  # Yellow - medium productivity
      prod_indicator="‚ö°"
    else
      prod_color="\033[36m"  # Cyan - normal
      prod_indicator="üí≠"
    fi
  else
    tokens_per_min=0
    prod_color="\033[36m"
    prod_indicator="üí≠"
  fi
  
  # Calculate cost per hour
  if [ $duration -gt 0 ]; then
    cost_per_hour=$(echo "$cost * 3600 / $duration" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.2f", $0}')
  else
    cost_per_hour="0.00"
  fi
else
  formatted_time="00:00:00"
  tokens_per_min=0
  cost_per_hour="0.00"
  prod_indicator="üí≠"
fi

# Build statusline
echo -e "\033[35m‚è±  ${formatted_time}\033[0m ‚îÇ \033[36m${model}\033[0m ‚îÇ ${prod_color}${prod_indicator} ${tokens_per_min}/min\033[0m ‚îÇ \033[33m\$${cost_per_hour}/hr\033[0m"
features: Elapsed session time in HH:MM:SS format
useCases: Track billable hours for client work
Monitor session productivity and efficiency
Budget management for API cost control
Time-boxed development sessions (Pomodoro technique)
Performance benchmarking across different models

troubleshooting.issue: Timer showing 00:00:00 or not incrementing
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure Claude Code is providing session.startTime in JSON. Check with: echo "$input" | jq '.session.startTime'. May require Claude Code update.

troubleshooting.issue: date command error: illegal time format
troubleshooting.solution: macOS uses 'date -j', Linux uses 'date -d'. Script may need adjustment for your OS. For Linux, replace '-j -f' with '-d'.

troubleshooting.issue: bc: command not found
troubleshooting.solution: Install bc calculator: brew install bc (macOS), apt install bc (Linux). Required for cost calculations.

troubleshooting.issue: Tokens per minute showing unrealistic values
troubleshooting.solution: This is normal at session start. Metric stabilizes after 2-3 minutes of usage. Very high values indicate batch processing.

statuslines.description: Ultra-lightweight plain text statusline with no colors or special characters for maximum compatibility and minimal overhead
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Simple Text Statusline for Claude Code
# Plain text only - maximum compatibility

# Read JSON from stdin
read -r input

# Extract values using bash built-ins (no jq required)
model=$(echo "$input" | grep -o '"model":"[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4)
dir=$(echo "$input" | grep -o '"path":"[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4 | sed "s|$HOME|~|")
tokens=$(echo "$input" | grep -o '"totalTokens":[0-9]*' | cut -d':' -f2)

# Default values if extraction fails
model=${model:-"unknown"}
dir=${dir:-"~"}
tokens=${tokens:-"0"}

# Build simple plain text status
echo "[Model: $model] [Dir: $dir] [Tokens: $tokens]"
features: No color codes or special characters
Works on any terminal including basic TTY
No jq or external tools required
Perfect for SSH sessions or slow connections
useCases: SSH sessions over slow or unreliable connections
Legacy terminals without color support
Screen reader accessibility requirements
Embedded systems or resource-constrained environments
Debugging when color codes cause issues
requirements: Basic grep and cut utilities (pre-installed on all Unix systems)

troubleshooting.issue: Values showing as empty or 'unknown'
troubleshooting.solution: JSON parsing relies on specific format. Ensure Claude Code is outputting standard JSON. Test with: echo '$input' to see raw JSON.

troubleshooting.issue: Home directory not shortened to ~
troubleshooting.solution: Check that $HOME environment variable is set correctly: echo $HOME. If using sudo, HOME may not be preserved.

troubleshooting.issue: grep or cut command not found
troubleshooting.solution: These are standard POSIX utilities. Install coreutils package: apt install coreutils (Linux) or ensure busybox is installed (embedded systems).

troubleshooting.issue: JSON parsing breaks when Claude Code changes output format
troubleshooting.solution: grep/cut parsing is fragile. Switch to jq-based statusline or use awk: awk 'BEGIN { FS="\""; RS="," }; { if ($2 == "model") {print $4} }' for robust parsing.

troubleshooting.issue: HOME not preserved when running script with sudo
troubleshooting.solution: Use sudo -H to set HOME or sudo -E to preserve variables. Add HOME to env_keep in /etc/sudoers for persistent fix. Test: sudo -H bash script.sh.

statuslines.description: Starship-inspired powerline statusline with Nerd Font glyphs, modular segments, and Git integration for Claude Code
statuslines.author: JSONbored
statuslines.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Starship-Inspired Powerline Theme
# Requires Nerd Font

read -r input

# Extract data
model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"' | sed 's/claude-//' | sed 's/sonnet/snnt/' | sed 's/-4-5//')
tokens=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.totalTokens // 0')
workdir=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.path // "."')

# Git info
cd "$workdir" 2>/dev/null
if git rev-parse --git-dir > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  branch=$(git symbolic-ref --short HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "detached")
  if [ -z "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
    git_icon=""
    git_color="\033[32m"
  else
    git_icon=""
    git_color="\033[33m"
  fi
  git_segment="${git_color}  ${branch} ${git_icon}\033[0m"
fi

# Model segment
model_segment="\033[36m ${model}\033[0m"

# Token segment with icon
token_k=$((tokens / 1000))
token_segment="\033[35m ${token_k}k\033[0m"

# Build powerline
echo -e "${model_segment} ${token_segment}${git_segment}"

troubleshooting.issue: Nerd Font glyphs showing as boxes or missing symbols
troubleshooting.solution: Install Nerd Font and configure terminal. Test: echo -e ' '. Set font to 'FiraCode Nerd Font Mono' or 'MesloLGS NF'. Run fc-cache -fv to refresh cache.

troubleshooting.issue: Git status shows '(detached)' instead of branch name
troubleshooting.solution: You're in detached HEAD state (normal for commit checkouts). Run git branch -q to see state. Checkout branch: git checkout main or create: git checkout -b feature-name.

troubleshooting.issue: Git icons not rendering correctly in VS Code terminal
troubleshooting.solution: Add to settings.json: "terminal.integrated.fontFamily": "'FiraCode Nerd Font Mono'". Restart VS Code. If issues persist, install: sudo apt install fonts-symbola.

troubleshooting.issue: Statusline displays incorrectly after git operations
troubleshooting.solution: Increase refreshInterval if statusline lags git state. Use git status --porcelain for reliable scripting. Verify read access: test -r .git && echo OK.

troubleshooting.issue: Model name abbreviation too aggressive or unclear
troubleshooting.solution: Modify sed patterns to preserve model info. Script shortens 'claude-sonnet-4-5' to 'snnt'. Keep full name by removing: | sed 's/sonnet/snnt/' line.
